values:
Take a look:
http://terriblerealestateagentphotos.com/
But don't drink while you read.
Season's greetings to everyone. :)

Hello everyone.
Do you remember the OWL cup? I have a few stories/drabbles I never posted anywhere else. Someone's asked me a while ago if they could post my German version of the fairy tales and I promised them to do it myself. So I finally got around to gathering the tiny chapters into a more comfortable chunk and posted the first chappie of the tale both in English and German on ff.net, and in English on TPP.
There'll be a few more, the bestial goat stories among them, and then that writery stuff will hopefully be tied up neatly.
I hope everyone is more or less ok, I checked in after all these storms but saw that everyone I know seems to be fine.
I'm still fluctuating between closing everything down and starting to post in earnest again - which is unreasonable and merely a sign of me being pretty much burned out. When being reasonable, I think I'll leave this open to keep in touch from time to time.

Hello, are you still here?
I don't know where the time went. I'm still buried in work and private stuff and still commuting - fandom still is too much for me, but I found an lj app for the ipad, so I'll try to at least catch up a bit about what's going on with all of you. In all honesty, I should shut down this site - but then, maybe not.

That said: the main reason for this post is to make one last self-pimp: A Most Important Element in Water, my seemingly endless WIP, is finally finished and posted on Ashwinder and ff.net. Some of you may remember... :) No more writing after that.
Happy Belated Birthday to my first ever lj friend . According to Flora's Dial the flower for May 26 is the Phlox. The PFAF database has a lot to say about the Phlox.

Happy Belated Birthday to and . According to Flora's Dial the flower for May 14 is the Sumach. The PFAF database has a lot to say about the Sumach. And I can add that alcoholic extracts from the leaves of Rhus typhina have insecticidal properties, too.

I'm so sorry for being late. Happy Belated Birthday to . According to Flora's Dial the flower for May 12 is the Star of Bethlehem. The PFAF database has a lot to say about the Star of Bethlehem. I think other Ornithogalum species go under that common name as well, so it would be interesting to look them up as well.
I'm so sorry for being late. Happy Belated Birthday to . According to Flora's Dial the flower for May 10 is the Red Poppy. The PFAF database has a lot to say about the poppy.

I'm briefly emerging from that work and rl stuff heap that's drowning me to pimp Jen's very cool Goblin humiliator: http://jjdebenedictis.blogspot.com/2011/05/introducing-goblins-humiliator.html

If I'll ever recover from the drowning, I'll sure get one. I'd love to play with the script. Wouldn't a Snape (insert fandom character of choice) humiliator be cool, too? 

Jen, for some reason I couldn't comment on your blog, so I do it here. I love it, it's great.

Happy Belated Birthday to . According to the very odd Flora's Dial the flower for April 20 is the Withered Rose. But I'm giving you a fresh one. The PFAF database has a lot to say about the rose. As you see, the dried petals can be used in teas, cakes and a spice mixture.

Happy Belated Birthday to . According to Flora's Dial the flower for April 10 is the Barberry. The PFAF database has a lot to say about the barberry. I've always loved them. It's fun to take a small stick and cause the stamen to move towards the pistil by touching the base of the blossom.
Happy Birthday to and . According to Flora's Dial the flower for April 5 is the Mouse-Ear Chickweed. You can read more about the plant here:Plants for a Future Database
Happy Belated Birthday to and . According to Flora's Dial the flower for April 2 is the Rush.

Just popping in to pimp something I like very much. Are you thinking about writing original fiction? Sending it off to an agent? What you need for that is a good query. Now, there are several agents and other helpful people who tutor and advise on how to write a good query. And there is the Query Goblin. The Query Goblin is the alter ego of my very first beta reader and friend Jen, some of you might know her as Mouse, that's how she posted art and fic in the Potter fandom. She's moved on to writing her own stories and she helps others by making suggestions on how they can improve their queries. So, if you're generally interested in the publishing process or want to write your own query, go and take a look. I've been following the Goblin for a while now and still am fascinated. You'll find it here: The Query Goblin.

I regularly browse the feeds of several newspapers, and while I was looking at pictures from Rio, I came across this: Samba-Magic!

cats and dogs don't get along? Since I'm not around much any more, I thought I'd give you the cute. I don't know how you people who are at home all the time do it. When I'm at work, I have my regular hours where I sit at my desk and do my work, then go home and do a bit of housework, relax, do fandom stuff. Now, off work for the moment, there's a LOT of getting the gardens in order, pruning trees, organizing stuff, doing this, doing that... in the evenings I'm so tired, I hardly make it to check my mail. I haven't read the flist in ages. I don't know how you do it. I know you people do that stuff, too, on top of looking after kids and work... I'll be back at work for a few more months in April. I better get my WIPs done and posted then, because when I'm off for good, I don't think I'll be able to do much fandom stuff. I'll have to do some thinking what to do about snapedom. If anyone feels the urge to get active there, tell me. But anyway, I hope you all are well. And I won't forget this time: Thank You, Grainne, for the emo button. :D
